thread.title: Barcelona's Gerard Pique hits back at Luis Enrique critics
thread.title_full: Barcelona's Gerard Pique hits back at Luis Enrique critics | Daily Mail Online

author: Adriana Garcia, Reuters
title: Barcelona's Gerard Pique hits back at Luis Enrique critics
text:
Barcelona defender Gerard Pique has decried the fans who booed manager Luis Enrique and the players in Sunday's laboured 2-1 home win over Leganes in La Liga as having a short-term memory.
The game was Barca's first since last week's 4-0 humiliation at Paris Saint-Germain in their Champions League last 16, first leg - the worst defeat of Enrique's coaching career.
Pique, a World Cup winner in 2010 and European champion in 2012 with Spain, said at a promotional event on Monday that the players and supporters owe the Barca boss a debt of gratitude for all the success he has brought since taking the helm in 2014.
Barcelona defender Gerard Pique has decried the fans who booed manager Luis Enrique
Enrique is under pressure after disappointing displays in La Liga and the Champions League
'When Luis Enrique arrived we were in the absolute s***,' Pique said. 'I would like that we remember all the work he has done with us and all that he did during his time as a player.
'I can't understand the booing, the short-term memory. It's eight titles out of (a possible) 10 with this coach. We are with him to the death.'
Among the eight titles, Enrique guided Barcelona to are a La Liga, Copa del Rey and Champions League treble in 2014-15. They retained La Liga and Copa del Rey titles last season. Barca have again reached the Copa del Rey final this term.
'We still have options in the three competitions, although in the Champions League it's very, very difficult,' Pique said.
A Lionel Messi penalty in the final minutes helped Barca scrape past lowly Leganes
Barca will hope to become the first team to recover from a 4-0 first-leg deficit in Europe's elite club competition to progress when they host PSG on March 8.
'We need to recover our game,' he said. 'We have been one-and-a-half months without playing the football that we're accustomed to. It's costing us more than usual. I'm certain the coach is in his office thinking about it.'
Barca will fall four points behind La Liga leaders Real Madrid on Wednesday if Zinedine Zidane's team win one of their two games in hand when they play at Valencia.
Edinson Cavani (right) celebrates after scoring Paris Saint Germain's fourth goal in Paris
Pique is annoyed that supporters booed Barcelona when they needed a late Lionel Messi penalty to beat Leganes.
'Barca is the club of my life and I know how things go,' he said.
'I can understand the discontent but I'm not in agreement on how it's manifested.'
